title: Known publicly available modified UPX ELF packer [closed]
content:
Closed. This question is off-topic. It is not currently accepting answers. Questions on software development are off-topic here, but can be asked on Stack Overflow. Closed 11 years ago. Improve this question Anyone know of any publicly available modified versions of UPX for ELF? I.e. one that is not able to be unpacked using 
upx -d
. The unpacking stub in the binary is slightly obfuscated. I am looking to identify the source of these modifications.

comments.text: Please give more details - I am not aware of such a list.
Jason, this had to do with reverse engineering because unpacking binaries and indentifiying the packer is reverse engineering.
but your question is just about a list (not unpacking or identifying), thus we can't contribute in that direction.

answers_data.content:
UPX is already managing ELF (see: UPX supported executable formats). Or, did I miss the point of your question ?
But, note that UPX is not designed for obfuscation purpose, it mainly aims at compressing the executable.

comments.text: I know it supports ELF. I have a binary that used a modified version of UPX in that the compression schemes, but that the unpacking stub is slightly obfuscated.
I better understand your question now. But, the best way to have an accurate answer would be to show the modification you found and/or part or the whole asm code of the packer prelude.
